qas.question: When was the low point for English football?

answers.text: the late '80s had marked a low point for English football

qas.question: Why was there a low point for English football?

answers.text: Stadiums were crumbling, supporters endured poor facilities, hooliganism was rife

qas.question: Why were the English clubs banned from European competition in the 1980's?

answers.text: English clubs were banned from European competition for five years following the Heysel Stadium disaster in 1985.

qas.question: Had the Football League First Division ever been in the top level?

answers.text: The Football League First Division, which had been the top level of English football since 1888
